title: How to Use the Amazon Category Lists by Kindletrends

tactics.name: category_filtering
tactics.description: Filter Amazon categories by name and top-level categories to identify relevant niches
steps: Use the 'Filter' function to search for keywords like 'historical'
Apply additional filters for top-level categories (e.g., 'History' and 'Nonfiction')
Review filtered results to identify 20-30 relevant categories
source_quotes: I can also filter at the same time on the top level categories to which each of these belong.

tactics.name: category_analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate category performance using popularity and activity metrics
steps: Check 'Top 100' and 'Last 30 Days' pages for category insights
Analyze sales rank bins (Top 1000, Top 10,000, etc.)
Assess activity levels via recent book publication counts
caveats: Metrics are relative; prioritize category fit over rankings
source_quotes: Popularity is a general measure of how high ranking the top books are... Activity is kind of the same thing, except for the number of books published in the last 30 days.

heuristics.name: popularity_threshold
heuristics.condition: If a category's popularity is in the Top 1000 bin, prioritize it for book placement
source_quotes: Categories tend to stay in these bins... a Top 1000 category doesn't tend to drop out of sight

claims.statement: Amazon Kindle Store categories maintain consistent popularity bins over time
source_quotes: What we see over time from looking at Kindletrends data is that categories tend to stay in these bins.

niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience segments by combining genre, sub-genre, and format
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Narrowing categories helps identify underserved niches with growth potential
source_quotes: If I click on one of them, then on the right hand side over here, you'll see the details for that category.
